docs.title: Welcome to MkDocs
docs.text: For full documentation visit mkdocs.org.

docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Must-read Books
docs.text:
• Code Complete by Steve McConnell
  • The Computer Science Starter Pack: Networks, Cryptography and Data Science by V. F. Filo Ferreira
  • The Computer Science Starter Pack: Everything a Programmer Needs to Know by V. F. Filo Ferreira
  • Grokking Algorithms by Aditya Bhargava
  • Code: The Hidden Language of Computer Hardware and Software by Charles Petzold

docs.title: File Navigation
docs.text:
• :e filename — open file
  • :Ex — open file explorer
  • :w — save
  • :q — quit

docs.title: Scrolling
docs.text:
• zz — scroll so current line is centered
  • zb — scroll so current line is at bottom
  • zt — scroll so current line is at top

docs.title: Navigation
docs.text:
• fx / Fx — move to next/previous occurrence of x
  • tx / Tx — move right before next/previous occurrence of x
  • ; / , — repeat/unrepeat last f, F, t, or T motion

docs.title: Mode Switching
docs.text: • <C-o> — switch to command mode temporarily for one command

docs.title: Text Casing
docs.text:
• ~ — invert case of the character under the cursor
  • g~ + range (e.g. g~e, g~$, g~iw, g~0) — invert case over a range
  • gu + range — lowercase over a range
  • gU + range — UPPERCASE over a range

docs.title: Folding
docs.text:
• zM — close all folds
  • zm — fold more (increase folding level)
  • zR — open all folds
  • zr — unfold one level
  • zO — open fold recursively under cursor
  • zo — open current fold

docs.title: Multicursor Editing (Visual Block)
docs.text:
1. <C-v> — enter Visual Block mode
  2. Use j / k to select multiple lines
  3. $ — move to end of each line
  4. A — append text at the end
  5. Type your text
  6. <Esc> — finish block insert

docs.title: Surround (via nvim-surround)
docs.text:
• ys{motion}{char} — add surrounding
  • ds{char} — delete surrounding
  • cs{target}{replacement} — change surrounding

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Old Text Command New Text surr*ound_words ysiw) (surround_words) *make strings ys$" "make strings" [delete ar*ound me!] ds] delete around me! remove <b>HTML t*ags</b> dst remove HTML tags 'change quot*es' cs'" "change quotes" <b>or tag* types</b> csth1<CR> <h1>or tag types</h1> delete(functi*on calls) dsf function calls

✅ Tip: Install nvim-surround with a plugin manager like lazy.nvim, packer.nvim, or vim-plug to use the surround shortcuts.
